requirement_tested: A fitness statistics homepage displaying user-specific fitness data
user_persona: Alex, a regular gym-goer who tracks progress weekly.
user_goal: To view my latest fitness stats including workouts, calories burned, and active minutes.

narrative_steps.title: Loading Dashboard
narrative_steps.description: Alex opens the app and navigates to the homepage to check his weekly stats.
narrative_steps.action: Navigate to the homepage URL.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: The page loads with a spinner, then displays summary cards and charts populated with Alex's fitness data.

narrative_steps.title: Refreshing Stats
narrative_steps.description: Curious about today's progress, Alex decides to refresh the data manually.
narrative_steps.action: Click the 'Refresh' button on the dashboard.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: The data reloads dynamically from the backend, updating all charts and summary cards instantly.

requirement_tested: Exercise recording functionality allowing users to log fitness activities
user_persona: Jamie, a fitness enthusiast who logs her daily workouts.
user_goal: To record a new running session she completed this morning.

narrative_steps.title: Filling Exercise Log
narrative_steps.description: Jamie goes to the exercise logging page and fills out details for her run.
narrative_steps.action: Select 'Running' from the dropdown, enter 45 mins duration, pick today's date, leave notes blank, and click Submit.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: The form validates successfully, submits the data, and clears the form fields upon success.

narrative_steps.title: Submitting Invalid Data
narrative_steps.description: Jamie tries submitting again but leaves the duration field empty.
narrative_steps.action: Leave duration blank and click Submit.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: Inline validation error appears next to the duration field without making an API call.

requirement_tested: Fitness diary feature enabling users to write and manage diary entries
user_persona: Taylor, who likes to reflect on his training journey through journaling.
user_goal: To add a new diary entry about how he felt after yesterday’s intense workout.

narrative_steps.title: Creating New Diary Entry
narrative_steps.description: Taylor writes a detailed note in the rich-text editor and saves it.
narrative_steps.action: Type content into the editor and click the 'Save' button.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: Entry is saved via POST request and immediately appears in the list below.

narrative_steps.title: Editing Existing Entry
narrative_steps.description: Taylor realizes he made a typo and edits the entry.
narrative_steps.action: Click the 'Edit' icon next to the entry, make corrections, and click Save.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: PUT request updates the entry and reflects changes in the list.

narrative_steps.title: Deleting Entry
narrative_steps.description: Deciding the entry isn’t needed anymore, Taylor deletes it.
narrative_steps.action: Click the 'Delete' icon and confirm deletion in the prompt.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: DELETE request removes the entry and it disappears from the list.

requirement_tested: Fitness leaderboard showing user rankings based on activity data
user_persona: Riley, who loves competing with others in the community.
user_goal: To see where she ranks compared to other users.

narrative_steps.title: Viewing Leaderboard
narrative_steps.description: Riley visits the leaderboard page to see current rankings.
narrative_steps.action: Navigate to the leaderboard page.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: Leaderboard table loads with usernames and workout counts, highlighting top 3 visually.

narrative_steps.title: Manually Refreshing Rankings
narrative_steps.description: After finishing a new workout, Riley wants to see if her rank improved.
narrative_steps.action: Click the 'Refresh Now' button.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: Leaderboard updates instantly by fetching fresh data from the server.

requirement_tested: User authentication system to manage individual fitness data
user_persona: Morgan, a new user signing up for the first time.
user_goal: To register an account and start tracking fitness activities.

narrative_steps.title: Registering Account
narrative_steps.description: Morgan fills out the registration form with her details.
narrative_steps.action: Enter username, email, password, and matching confirmation password, then click Register.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: Account is created, Morgan is automatically logged in, and redirected to the dashboard.

narrative_steps.title: Logging In
narrative_steps.description: Returning the next day, Morgan logs back in using her credentials.
narrative_steps.action: Enter email and password, then click Login.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: JWT token is stored securely and Morgan is redirected to her personalized dashboard.

requirement_tested: Backend API to serve fitness data to the frontend
user_persona: Developer working on integrating frontend features.
user_goal: To verify that backend endpoints return correct JSON responses.

narrative_steps.title: Testing Auth Endpoint
narrative_steps.description: Developer sends a POST request to authenticate a user.
narrative_steps.action: Send POST request to `/api/auth/login` with valid credentials.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: Returns a JSON object with a valid JWT token and user info.

narrative_steps.title: Fetching User Exercises
narrative_steps.description: Developer verifies that the exercises endpoint returns filtered results.
narrative_steps.action: Send GET request to `/api/exercises?userId={validUserId}`.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: Returns a JSON array of exercises associated with the specified user ID.

requirement_tested: Frontend application that fetches all data dynamically from backend APIs
user_persona: Casey, exploring different parts of the app.
user_goal: To navigate between sections and observe real-time data loading.

narrative_steps.title: Visiting Diary Page
narrative_steps.description: Casey clicks on the Diary link to review past entries.
narrative_steps.action: Click the 'Diary' navigation item.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: Page shows a loading spinner, followed by a list of diary entries fetched from the backend.

narrative_steps.title: Encountering Network Error
narrative_steps.description: While offline, Casey attempts to load the leaderboard.
narrative_steps.action: Attempt to navigate to the leaderboard while disconnected.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: Toast notification informs Casey that data could not be loaded, offering a retry option.

requirement_tested: Database connection to PostgreSQL using specified environment variables
user_persona: DevOps engineer setting up the production environment.
user_goal: To ensure the backend connects properly to the PostgreSQL database.

narrative_steps.title: Starting Backend Service
narrative_steps.description: Engineer sets the required environment variables and starts the backend service.
narrative_steps.action: Set DB_HOST=localhost, DB_PORT=5432, etc., and run the backend process.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: Service initializes successfully and establishes a connection pool to the PostgreSQL database.

requirement_tested: UI styled with white background and navy-colored components
user_goal: To confirm that all UI elements follow the defined color scheme.

narrative_steps.title: Inspecting Homepage Design
narrative_steps.description: Designer inspects the homepage layout to verify styles match guidelines.
narrative_steps.action: Open homepage in browser and inspect CSS variables applied to components.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: Global styles apply --bg-color: #FFFFFF and --primary-color: #000080 to all relevant elements.

requirement_tested: Ability for users to browse their own recorded exercises
user_persona: Jordan, reviewing his month-long fitness history.
user_goal: To look through previous exercise logs sorted by date.

narrative_steps.title: Loading First Batch of Records
narrative_steps.description: Jordan opens the exercise browsing page to see his earliest entries.
narrative_steps.action: Visit the exercise log browsing page.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: Paginated table displays Jordan’s exercises, sorted by default descending date.

narrative_steps.title: Sorting by Duration
narrative_steps.description: Jordan wants to find his longest workouts.
narrative_steps.action: Click the 'Duration' column header.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: Table re-renders with rows ordered by duration from highest to lowest.

requirement_tested: Data visualization components for fitness statistics
user_persona: Sam, analyzing monthly trends in fitness performance.
user_goal: To adjust the time frame of the displayed statistics.

narrative_steps.title: Changing Time Range
narrative_steps.description: Sam selects 'Last Month' from the time selector dropdown.
narrative_steps.action: Choose 'Last Month' from the date range selector.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: Charts update dynamically to show activity data from the last 30 days.

requirement_tested: Input forms for recording new exercises and diary entries
user_persona: Quinn, adding multiple new items quickly.
user_goal: To fill out and reset forms efficiently.

narrative_steps.title: Entering Exercise Details
narrative_steps.description: Quinn fills in the exercise form with swimming data.
narrative_steps.action: Fill out form fields and blur each one to trigger validation.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: Validation messages appear under incorrect fields as Quinn moves away from them.

narrative_steps.title: Resetting Form
narrative_steps.description: After saving, Quinn wants to clear the form for another entry.
narrative_steps.action: Click the 'Reset' button.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: All input fields are cleared and form returns to its initial state.

requirement_tested: Real-time updating of leaderboard and statistics
user_goal: To see live updates on the leaderboard after completing a challenge.

narrative_steps.title: Waiting for Auto-Update
narrative_steps.description: Blake stays on the leaderboard page waiting for automatic refresh.
narrative_steps.action: Remain idle on the leaderboard page for more than 60 seconds.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: Leaderboard data automatically updates with the latest rankings from the server.

requirement_tested: User profile management for personal fitness settings
user_goal: To change preferred measurement units and set a new goal weight.

narrative_steps.title: Updating Preferences
narrative_steps.description: Avery modifies settings in the profile section.
narrative_steps.action: Change preferred units to kg, enter new goal weight, and click Save.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: Profile settings are updated via PUT request and a success message is shown.

requirement_tested: Repository configuration with package.json supporting npm run install:all and npm run dev
user_persona: New developer joining the project team.
user_goal: To get both frontend and backend running locally with minimal effort.

narrative_steps.title: Installing Dependencies
narrative_steps.description: Developer clones the repo and runs the setup command.
narrative_steps.action: Run `npm run install:all` in root directory.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: Both frontend and backend dependencies install concurrently without errors.

narrative_steps.title: Starting Development Servers
narrative_steps.description: Developer launches both environments together.
narrative_steps.action: Run `npm run dev` in root directory.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: Frontend and backend servers start simultaneously and are accessible in development mode.
